    <item>
      <title>
	HPV vaccine should be extended to boys, say MPs and peers
      </title>
      <link>
	http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-5404255/HPV-vaccine-extended-boys-say-MPs-peers.html?ITO=1490&ns_mchannel=rss&ns_campaign=1490
      </link>
      <description>
	The Minister in charge of vaccine policy has been urged by MPs and peers to start immunising boys as well as girls against the cancer-causing Human Papilloma Virus (HPV).
      </description>
      <enclosure url="http://i.dailymail.co.uk/i/pix/2018/02/17/21/4954461E00000578-0-image-m-15_1518903817481.jpg" type="image/jpeg" length="4958"/>

      <title>
	Boys unsure about gender 'pronounce letter S with lisp'
      </title>
      <link>
	http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sciencetech/article-5402005/Boys-unsure-gender-pronounce-letter-S-lisp.html?ITO=1490&ns_mchannel=rss&ns_campaign=1490

	Controversial badger cull to stamp out TB could extend
      </title>
      <link>
	http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sciencetech/article-5402309/Controversial-badger-cull-stamp-TB-extend.html?ITO=1490&ns_mchannel=rss&ns_campaign=1490

    <item>
      <title>
	Listen to blue whales calling to each other
      </title>
      <link>
	http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sciencetech/article-5402121/Listen-blue-whales-calling-other.html?ITO=1490&ns_mchannel=rss&ns_campaign=1490
      </link>
      <description>
	Researchers recorded the sounds of endangered blue whales living near Southern California. They analyzed more than 4,500 of the sounds to dissect the whales' communication.

      <title>
	Google removes 'view image' tool
      </title>
      <link>
	http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sciencetech/article-5402111/Web-users-furious-Google-removes-view-image-tool.html?ITO=1490&ns_mchannel=rss&ns_campaign=1490

    <item>
      <title>
	ARE BLUE WHALES IN DANGER? 
      </title>
      <link>
	http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sciencetech/fb-5402173/ARE-BLUE-WHALES-DANGER.html?ITO=1490&ns_mchannel=rss&ns_campaign=1490

    <item>
      <title>
	Scientists create new form of light as photons interact
      </title>
      <link>
	http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sciencetech/article-5401933/Scientists-create-new-form-light-photons-interact.html?ITO=1490&ns_mchannel=rss&ns_campaign=1490
      </link>
      <description>
	A team of researchers from MIT and Harvard said the new form of light happens when three photons stick together, which is remarkable given that the light particles typically refuse to interact.
      </description>
      <enclosure url="http://i.dailymail.co.uk/i/pix/2018/02/16/21/494C6FD400000578-0-image-a-25_1518816136559.jpg" type="image/jpeg" length="10776"/>

      <guid>
	http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sciencetech/article-5401933/Scientists-create-new-form-light-photons-interact.html?ITO=1490&ns_mchannel=rss&ns_campaign=1490
      </guid>
      <media:description></media:description>
      <media:thumbnail url="http://i.dailymail.co.uk/i/pix/2018/02/16/21/494C6FD400000578-0-image-a-25_1518816136559.jpg" width="154" height="115"/>

      <media:content type="image/jpeg" url="http://i.dailymail.co.uk/i/pix/2018/02/16/21/494C6FD400000578-0-image-a-25_1518816136559.jpg"/>
    </item>
    <item>
      <title>
	HOW DID SCIENTISTS CREATE A NEW FORM OF LIGHT?  
      </title>
      <link>
	http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sciencetech/fb-5402133/HOW-DID-SCIENTISTS-CREATE-NEW-FORM-LIGHT.html?ITO=1490&ns_mchannel=rss&ns_campaign=1490
      </link>
      <description>
	A team of researchers from MIT and Harvard were able to make photons interact by sending them through an ultracold, dense cloud of rubidium atoms.
      </description>
      <enclosure url="http://i.dailymail.co.uk/i/pix/2018/02/16/21/494C6FD400000578-0-image-a-25_1518816136559.jpg" type="image/jpeg" length="10776"/>

    <item>
      <title>
	WHAT IS QUANTUM ENTANGLEMENT?
      </title>
      <link>
	http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sciencetech/fb-5402107/WHAT-QUANTUM-ENTANGLEMENT.html?ITO=1490&ns_mchannel=rss&ns_campaign=1490
      </link>
      <description>
	In quantum physics, entangled particles remain connected so that actions performed by one affects the behaviour of the other, even if they are separated by huge distances.
      </description>
      <enclosure url="http://i.dailymail.co.uk/i/pix/2018/02/16/23/494D274A00000578-0-image-a-9_1518824886780.jpg" type="image/jpeg" length="4840"/>

    <item>
      <title>
	Cuttlefish spikes out skin as part of camouflage tactic
      </title>
      <link>
	http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sciencetech/article-5401707/Watch-moment-cuttlefish-unfurls-spikes-skin.html?ITO=1490&ns_mchannel=rss&ns_campaign=1490

    <item>
      <title>
	CCTV cameras will soon have face recognition technology
      </title>
      <link>

      <description>

    <item>
      <title>
	FedEx admits server left thousands of customers exposed
      </title>
      <link>
	http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sciencetech/article-5400755/FedEx-admits-server-left-THOUSANDS-customers-exposed.html?ITO=1490&ns_mchannel=rss&ns_campaign=1490
      </link>
      <description>

    <item>
      <title>
	FROM MATCH.COM TO TINDER: A BRIEF HISTORY OF THE RISE OF
      </title>
      <link>
	http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sciencetech/fb-5396529/FROM-MATCH-COM-TINDER-BRIEF-HISTORY-RISE-OF.html?ITO=1490&ns_mchannel=rss&ns_campaign=1490
      </link>
      <description>
